myMath

Interface Polynom_able

  • All Superinterfaces:
    cont_function, function
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Polynom

    public interface Polynom_able
extends cont_function
    This interface represents a general Polynom: f(x) = a_1X^b_1 + a_2*X^b_2 ... a_n*Xb_n, where: a_1, a_2 ... a_n are real numbers and b_1=0 are none negative integers (naturals) For formal definitions see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polynomial
    Author:
    Omer Paz,Shimon Mimoun

        boolean equals(Polynom_able p1)

      • isZero

        boolean isZero()
        Test if this is the Zero Polynom
        Returns:
        True is a Zero Polynom else false

      • root

        double root(double x0,
            double x1,
            double eps)
        How to calculate root with bisection method. Compute a value x' (x0<=x'<=x1) for with |f(x')| < eps assuming (f(x0)*f(x1)<=0, returns f(x2) such that: * (i) x0<=x2<=x2 && (ii) f(x2)
        Parameters:
        x0 - starting point
        x1 - end point
        eps - step (positive) value
        Returns:
        the value closest to the function on the x-axis

      • copy

        Polynom_able copy()
        Create a deep copy of this Polynom
        Returns:
        Deep copy of Polynom original

      • derivative

        Polynom_able derivative()
        Calculates the derivative of the given function.For more information on the derivatives :https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Derivative
        Returns:
        new Polynom after a derivative

      • area

        double area(double x0,
            double x1,
            double eps)
        Compute Riemann's Integral over this Polynom starting from x0, till x1 using eps size steps, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral
        Specified by:
        area in interface cont_function
        Parameters:
        x0 - starting point
        x1 - end point
        eps - positive step value
        Returns:
        the approximated area above the x-axis below this Polynom and between the [x0,x1] range.

      • iteretor

        An Iterator (of Monoms) over this Polynom
        Returns:
        Iterator specific of the array

      • underX_area

        double underX_area(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        Compute Riemann's Integral over this Polynom starting from x0, till x1 using eps size steps, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral
        Parameters:
        x0 - starting point
        x1 - end point
        eps - positive step value
        Returns:
        the approximated area under X axis below this Polynom and between the [x0,x1] range.

      • PrintMinMax

        void PrintMinMax(java.lang.String s,
                 double x0,
                 double x1)
        Search for Minimum and Maximum points, and add them to the Graphic Drawing.
        Parameters:
        s - Receiv String in the form of a Polynom, expample of right string for Printing: 0.2*X^4+(0-1.5)*X^3+3*X^2+(0-X)+(0-5).
        x0 - lower definition domain
        x1 - higher definition domain
